alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Lavaca (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 4:10AM CST until January 28 at 4:36PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Morales affecting Jackson and Lavaca Counties. For the Navidad River...including Morales...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navidad River at Morales. * WHEN...Until Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 34.0 feet, Major lowland flooding begins with several feet of water over the approaches to the County Road 283 bridge and water threatening the bridge floor. The lowest homes in the flood plain are threatened near Vienna and in northern Jackson County. Livestock should be removed from the flood plain from the headwaters to Lake Texana. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 29.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 AM CST Friday was 29.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 32.4 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 32.7 feet on 06/18/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Navidad River Morales 29.0 29.0 Fri 4 am CST 31.8 28.7 17.3 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1015 PM CST.
